meanings.definition: To make four times as great or as many.
meanings.sent1: She decided to quadruplicate the number of cupcakes for the party.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to quadruplicate its profits by expanding overseas.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to quadruplicate the rabbit, but ended up with a hat full of carrots instead.
meanings.sent4: His excitement seemed to quadruplicate with each step closer to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's goal was to quadruplicate the amount of energy produced by the new solar panels.

meanings.definition: A group or set of four identical things.
meanings.sent1: The quadruplicate of keys made it easy for everyone in the family to have a copy.
meanings.sent2: The store sold a quadruplicate of matching chairs for the dining table.
meanings.sent3: The quadruplicate of puppies all had the same playful energy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room in a quadruplicate of giggles.
meanings.sent5: The quadruplicate of paintings hung on the wall created a sense of symmetry in the room.
